title: Ben Brintz
text:
Ben J. Brintz
ben.brintz@hsc.utah.edu
EDUCATION
PhD in Statistics, Oregon State, Corvallis, OR, March 2018
- Dissertation: A Normal Approximation to N-Mixture Models with Applications in Large Abundance Estimation and Disease Surveillance
MS in Statistics, Oregon State, Corvallis, OR, June 2014
- Conducted Unit/Sub-unit sample size study on second growth forest tree harvest effect on the Oregon Slender Salamander
- Used simulation and Just Another Gibbs Sampler in R to implement multilevel logistic regression model for estimation and precision analysis across various settings
BA in Mathematics/Statistics, Grinnell College, Grinnell, IA, May 2010

title: Ben Brintz
text:
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.
library(tidyverse)
create_triangle <- function(row) { x <- c(0, 1, 0.5) y <- c(0, 0, sqrt(3)/2)
df <- data.frame(x, y) gg <- ggplot(df, aes(x, y)) + geom_polygon(fill = “blue”) + coord_fixed() + theme_void() + xlim(c(-0.1, 1.1)) + ylim(c(-0.1, 1.1))
for(i in seq(1, row-1)) { x_offset <- i/2 y_offset <- i * sqrt(3)/2
df_upper <- data.frame(x + x_offset, y + y_offset)
df_lower <- data.frame(x - x_offset, y + y_offset)

gg <- gg + 
  geom_polygon(data = df_upper, aes(x, y), fill = "blue") +
  geom_polygon(data = df_lower, aes(x, y), fill = "blue")
}
return(gg) }
create_triangle(10)

title: Ben Brintz
text:
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.
library(tidyverse)
create_triangle <- function(row) { x <- c(0, 1, 0.5) y <- c(0, 0, sqrt(3)/2)
df <- data.frame(x, y) gg <- ggplot(df, aes(x, y)) + geom_polygon(fill = “blue”) + coord_fixed() + theme_void() + xlim(c(-0.1, 1.1)) + ylim(c(-0.1, 1.1))
for(i in seq(1, row-1)) { x_offset <- i/2 y_offset <- i * sqrt(3)/2
df_upper <- data.frame(x + x_offset, y + y_offset)
df_lower <- data.frame(x - x_offset, y + y_offset)

gg <- gg + 
  geom_polygon(data = df_upper, aes(x, y), fill = "blue") +
  geom_polygon(data = df_lower, aes(x, y), fill = "blue")
}
return(gg) }
create_triangle(10)
